transcript_chunks.text: Somerville is the new game from jump ship a brand new studio formed by folks behind inside in limbo upon starting Summerville it's evident that the same Talent is there incredible visuals accompanied by one of the coolest openings to a video game in recent memory except the tone for something special while the energy and Vibe of Somerville is just as potent is inside the game's transition to 3D isn't as kind to its gameplay Somerville is a 4 out of 5 game I highly recommend it for its intense story basing you in a sci-fi thriller that stays nail-biting from moment to moment without even a single line of dialogue spoken like its predecessors before it you're on the run but Somerville is clear in its premise you're a civilian caught in the middle of an Interstellar conflict I'll reveal anything further because discovering the story is part of the journey but what I will say is that carrying the journey are striking visuals that are the star of the show here even though at times the

anything further because discovering the story is part of the journey but what I will say is that carrying the journey are striking visuals that are the star of the show here even though at times the brightness and contrast can be a bit much Somerville is less puzzle platformer and more puzzle Adventure game this time around many of the puzzles are great with mechanics allowing you to affect states of matter to progress forward that said there are some unintuitive puzzles that were more annoying than exciting to solve along with moments where the controls fought against what I wanted to do think like classic choose Runner Adventure Jake all in all though I really enjoyed Somerville if you like short puzzle Adventures or sci-fi Thrillers it's more than worth picking up you can hear more about it on kind of funny games for now I should let you know that
